markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 16"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Dispelling Spellstrike](/Feats.aspx?ID=2880) <actions string="Three Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Magus" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=389" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Secrets of Magic](/Sources.aspx?ID=96) pg. 49 <sup>1.1</sup></row>

**Prerequisites**
[Spellstrike](/Actions.aspx?ID=755)

**Requirements**
Your Spellstrike is charged.

</column>

---

The spell you deliver tries to force out magic affecting your enemy. Make a Spellstrike. If it hits, you also attempt to [counteract](/Rules.aspx?ID=371) a single spell (of your choice) active on the target. The counteract level is half your level rounded up, and the counteract check modifier is the standard modifier for counteracting with a spell (your Intelligence modifier plus your spellcasting proficiency bonus, plus any bonuses or penalties that specifically apply to counteract checks).
name: Dispelling Spellstrike
